intro: Farsetia stenoptera subsp. boivinii, commonly known as the Boivin's farsetia, is a rare and striking member of the Gesneriaceae family. It is characterized by its compact, evergreen growth habit and vividly colored, tubular flowers that range from orange to red. Native to Madagascar, this subspecies thrives in humid, shaded environments within tropical rainforests. Its leaves are typically elliptical with a glossy surface, and the plant produces small, clustered inflorescences. Due to its rarity and ornamental value, it is highly sought after by botanists and horticulturists.
